intro: Pentanisia schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, oval fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
